member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.BCSManagementRequestDTO

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.BCSManagementRequestDTO.GetAllSessionsInformation
member.summary: Asks the Data Connector to return an array of eventguid-sessionguid-session name pairs for all sessions in the scoring file.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.BCSManagementRequestDTO.Command
member.summary: Must be (a combination of) one of the constants above. Valid are: 1 (ShutDownNow), 2 (GetRunningSessions), 4 (GetScoringFileLocation), 2+4, 8 (GetAllSessionsInformation)

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO
member.summary: Contains all settings for the Bridgemate 3 for a section. Mind that all values must be supplied.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3ScreenBrightness
member.summary: Valid values 1-7. Defines the screen brightness.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3ScreenDimMode
member.summary: Valid values 0-15. Defines the number of seconds(times 5) before the screen of the Bridgemate will dim.So the default value of 2 amounts to 10 seconds.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3ScreenOffMode
member.summary: Valid values 0-15. Defines the number of seconds (times 5) before the screen of the Bridgemate will turn off. A value of zero, the default, means "never turn off".

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3SleepMode
member.summary: Valid values 0-120. Defines the number of seconds (times 5) before the Bridgemate will enter Sleepmode. Once the Bridgemate has entered sleepmode its powerbutton must be used to wake it up again.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3AudioVolume
member.summary: Valid values 0-7. Currently not in use.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3Language
member.summary: Specifies which language the Bridgemate will use. The default is zero for English.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3ConnectionMode
member.summary: Specifies if the Bridgemates for this section will operate in offline mode. In offline mode the Bridgemate will not communicate with the Bridgemate 3 server during the session, but will try to send its results after the last board had been played.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3PINcode
member.summary: Must be four digits. The code the TD must enter to get access to the TD menu. Defaults to "0000".

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3ConfirmNP
member.summary: Specifies if the TD must confirm a "Not Played". Default Off

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3TDCall
member.summary: Specifies if players can call for the Tournament Director using the Bridgemate.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3ResultMethod
member.summary: Specifies how players can enter the result for a board: Up/Down tricks, total tricks or American style.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3BoardResultReentry
member.summary: Specifies if players may reenter the result of the board after the original entry has been confirmed by the opponents.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.Bridgemate3SettingsDTO.BM3LeadCardEntry
member.summary: Specifies if the leadcard must be enterd together with the contract and if the leadcard should be validated againts the handrecord.

member.summary: Specifies if and when the players can make themselves known by entering their playernumber and/or name on the Bridgemate.

member.summary: Specifies whether starting positions should be confirmed by players at start of the session

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ContinueDTO
member.summary: Instructs BCS to continue working with a previously created event using the ScoringProgramPipeClient.Continue method or the ScoringProgramPipeClient.ContinueAsync method.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ContinueDTO.EventGuid
member.summary: Tells BCS which event to continue. When there is only one session the event guid will be its session guid unless it was set to a different value in the original InitDTO.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ContinueDTO.Commands
member.summary: 1: Just start BCS and let it reconnect to the last used scoring file if it contains a session with the correct guid. 5: Start BCS, let it reconnect and start reading. add 128: clear all previous data from the Data Connector.

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO
member.summary: Contains information on how to construct a new event, with its sessions, sections, tables and rounds. Optionally player data, participations and handrecords can be added. Doing this is more performant than adding them later. Is used as a parameter for the ScoringProgramPipeClient.Initialize or the ScoringProgramPipeClient.InitializeAsync method.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.StartBCS
member.summary: Instructs the Data Connector to start BCS.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Command_Reset
member.summary: Instructs BCS to create a new event from the data in this DTO.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Command_StartReading
member.summary: Instructs BCS to start reading from the Data Connector.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Command_ShowInApp
member.summary: Instructs BCS to upload the sessions to the Bridgemate App server.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Command_Minimize
member.summary: Instructs BCS to start minimized.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Command_AutoShutDownBPC
member.summary: Instructs BCS to shut down after the last result has been processed.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Command_LogLevel_Debug
member.summary: Sets the log level to "Debug" rather than "Info".

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Command_ClearData
member.summary: Instructs the Data Connector to clear all its previous data and start with a clean slate.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.Commands
member.summary:
Instructions to BCS. Add up the values to combine.
1. Start BCS (if not already started).
2: Reset the Bridgemates (and App) and fill them with the provided data.
4: Start Reading from the Bridgemates, Data Connector (and App).
8: Upload the sessions to the app.
16: Minimize BCS
32:Close BCS when all results have been processed.
64: Lower the logging level from "Info" to "Debug".
128:Clear all previous data from the Data Connector queue.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.InitDTO.EventGuid
member.summary: Required if the number of sessions is greater than one. This signals that BCS should administer these sessions together.

member.summary: Optional: the data of at least the players that will participate in the sessions. Player data is required for every participation that has its a SessionGuid and PlayerNumber properties set.

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO
member.summary: This class can be used: 1. To give names for the players in the first round by only specifying their player numbers. For this to work the names belonging to the playernumber must have been passed first using PlayerDTO's. 2. To give names for the players in the first round by omitting their playernumber. In this case the players will be registerd for this session only. The combination of both playernumber and name details is not supported.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO.SessionGuid
member.summary: Required. The guid of the session the participation belongs to. A string built from a Guid, without the curly braces or connecting dashes. The letters must be capitals

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO.SectionLetters
member.summary: Required. The letters of the section the participation belongs to. Can be A-Z, AA, BB, CC,...ZZ, AAA, BBB, CCC, ... ZZZ

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO.TableNumber
member.summary: Required. The number of the table for the player in the round.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO.Direction
member.summary: Required. The position on the table for the player in the round. 1: North 2: East 3: South 4: West

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO.RoundNumber
member.summary: Currently only the values zero and one are supported. They are treated the same as the table where the player sits in the first round. Optional, specifying a number higher than 1 indicates that the name of the player has become known in a latter round. BCS will use the known movement to calculate the player's positions in other rounds.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO.PlayerNumber
member.summary: Optional, but must be present together with the SessionGuid if no name details are passed. The playernumber must have been passed beforehand using a PlayerDTO containg the name details.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO.IsPlayerSwap
member.summary: Signals that this player was swapped with his partner: North was swapped with South, or East with West.
member.remarks: This property is only menaningful in conjunction with a PollQueueForNewParticipations command, or a PollQueueForAllParticipations> command.

A scoring group must have at least one section, though this can be omitted when using this DTO for scoring group updates. If a scoring group has more than one section the score calculation will treat these sections as if they were one.

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO
member.summary: This class is a container for participants that can potentially meet each other during the session. Their results will be compared and they will be ranked against each other. Note: if the section is part of a scoringgroup together with an other section the scoring calculation will treat these sections as one.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.GameType_Pairs
member.summary: The section hosts a pairs competition. Rankings will be for each pair.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.GameType_Individual
member.summary: The section hosts an individual competition. Rankings will be for each player.

member.name: F:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.GameType_Teams
member.summary: The section hosts a teams competition. Rankings will be for each teams (although a parallel pairs ranking is possible).

member.summary: Required. The guid of the session the section is part of. A string built from a Guid, without the curly braces or connecting dashes. The letters must be capitals

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.ScoringGroupNumber
member.summary: Required, the number of the scoringgroup the section belongs to. Must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.Letters
member.summary: Required. The letters of the section. They must be unique within an event. Can be A-Z, AA, BB, CC,...ZZ, AAA, BBB, CCC, ... ZZZ

member.summary: Optional.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.Winners
member.summary: Required: either 1 or 2.

member.summary: Negative value: the eastwest pairs move down the specified number of tables before play starts. Positive value: the eastwest pairs move up the specified number of tables before play starts. Zero: the eastwest pairs do not move. Currently not supported.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.MissingPair
member.summary: Optional. A pair that is missing throughout the movement. Alternatively this can be specified by Leaving out the opponent for a pair that would have met the missing pair. However, BCS will be able to discern a sit-out table from an empty table if this value is used.

member.summary: If true the NorthSouthPairSectionLetters and the EastWestPairSectionLetters must have the value for an existing section.

member.summary: Required if IsCombiSection is True. Must be the letters for an existing section. The letters of the section the North-South pairs in the combisection originate from.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.SectionDTO.EastWestPairSectionLetters
member.summary: Required if IsCombisection is True. Must be the letters for an existing section. The letters of the section the East-West pairs in the combisection originate from.

member.summary: An array of TableDTOs. All tables for the section must be specified.

member.name: M:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramHttpClient.SendPlayerDataAsync(System.String,BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.PlayerDataDTO[])
member.summary: Sends PlayerData to the BCS queue.
member.param: The organization that gives out the playernumbers
a DTO containing the player data:playernumber, first name, last name, country code
member.remarks: Best practice is to send all player data first, even before initializing the session. After the session starts preferably the data is not changed to prevent unpredictable behaviour. By sending ParticipationDTOs you can specify which players start on which direction on which table. If all players are known before the session starts only the participants of the session need to be uploaded. If players will make themselves known at session start-up by entering their playernumber on the Bridgemate then all playernumbers that could be entered should be uploaded.

member.summary: Sends participations to the BCS queue.
member.param: The guid of the session that all participations must belong to.
member.remarks: Best practice is to send PlayerNumbers only. For this to work the PlayerDataDTOs have to be sent beforehand.

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramPipeClient
member.summary:
Handles request from the scoring programs. This code is freely available for external programmers to adapt to their specific needs. This code, however, is guaranteed to work. Interop options are available for many programming languages.
Note that this class is written as a singleton: there should never be more than one instance communicating over the pipe. The constructor is protected however, so by inheriting from this class a non singleton instance can be used.
The class implements IDispable through its base class, as the base class contains a stream writer and stream reader that must be disposed when the communication shuts down. Be sure to call Dispose on the class any time it is no longer in use, otherwise communication will stall.
The code has no dependencies, except one on NLog. If you decide to copy the code make sure to add a dependency to the NLog NuGet package or implement your own logging.The logger is defined in the base class and is named "DataConnectorClientLogger".
All public functions have synchronous and asynchronous implementation (ending in "Async").
To get started inspect the following functions:
Connect and ConnectAsync: Connection to the Data Connector.
Initialize and InitializeAsync: Initialization of a new event.
IssueManagementCommand and IssueManagementCommandAsync: Query the Bridgemate Control Software.

member.name: M:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramPipeClient.SendPlayerDataAsync(System.String,BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.PlayerDataDTO[])
member.summary: Sends PlayerData asynchronously to the BCS queue.
member.param: The guid of the session that player participates in.
a DTO containing the player data:playernumber, first name, last name, country code
member.remarks: Best practice is to send all player data with the InitDTO. After the session starts preferably the data is not changed to prevent unpredictable behaviour. By sending ParticipationDTOs, again preferable with the InitDTO, you can specify which players start on which direction on which table. If all players are known before the session starts only the corresponding player data of the participants of the session needs to be uploaded. If players will make themselves known at session start-up by entering their playernumber on the Bridgemate then all playernumbers that could be entered should be uploaded using a PlayerDataDTO.

member.param: The guid of the session that player participates in.
a DTO containing the player data:playernumber, first name, last name, country code
member.remarks: Best practice is to send all player data with the InitDTO. After the session starts preferably the data is not changed to prevent unpredictable behaviour. By sending ParticipationDTOs, again preferable with the InitDTO, you can specify which players start on which direction on which table. If all players are known before the session starts only the corresponding player data of the participants of the session needs to be uploaded. If players will make themselves known at session start-up by entering their playernumber on the Bridgemate then all playernumbers that could be entered should be uploaded using a PlayerDataDTO.

member.name: M:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramPipeClient.SendParticipationsAsync(System.String,BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnectorClasses.SharedDTO.ParticipationDTO[])
member.summary: Sends participations asynchronously to the BCS queue.
member.param: The guid of the session that all participations must belong to.
member.remarks: Participations can be sent in two ways: 1. Setting the SessionGuid and PlayerNumber property only. In this case a PlayerDataDTO with this SessionGuid-PlayerNumber must have been uploaded too. 2.Specifying the SessionGuid and at least the LastName property, but not the PlayerNumber. In this case no corresponding PlayerData having been sent before is expected. Setting both the PlayerNumber and LastName property will result in an error.

member.name: M:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramPipeClient.AcceptQueueData(System.String,BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.DataConnectorResponseData)
member.summary: Signals to the Data Connector synchronously that a specific type of queuedata up to the specified id does not need to be sent again.
member.param: The guid of the session to accept the specific eventqueue data for.
The type of eventqueue data to accept (results, handrecords, participations, etc.).
member.remarks: The Data Connector requires an id of the last downloaded eventqueue item of the given type. These id's are stored as fields in this class. You can also choose to make the last eventqueue id (for the given type!) a parameter of this method.

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramRequest
member.summary: This class carries both a command and its associated data (if any) for the Data Connector. If the command pertains to a specific session the SessionGuid property has to be set. Validation will check in that case if the SessionGuid properties of the SerializedData has the same value. The Data Connector always responds with a ScoringProgramResponse
member.remarks: Note that the ScoringProgramRequest itself is sent as JSON data to the Data Connector. So the SerializedData property contains nested JSON data.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramRequest.Command
member.summary: Required. The command that the Data Connector must pass on to BCS.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramRequest.SessionGuid
member.summary: Required if the command pertains to a session. Must be empty otherwise.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramRequest.SerializedData
member.summary: The data associated with the command, if any. Must be serialized as JSON.

member.name: T:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramResponse
member.summary: This class carries the response data that the Data Connector sends back after sending it a ScoringProgramRequest.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramResponse.RequestCommand
member.summary: The command of the request that this is the reponse for.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramResponse.DataType
member.summary: Specifies the datatype to deserialize to after rececption of the response. Data ConnectorResponseData.Error signals that something went wrong. The serialized data will be a string describing the error.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramResponse.LastQueueItemId
member.summary: If the response contains queue data the id of last added queueitem.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramResponse.ErrorType
member.summary: Specifies the type of error that occurred. ErrorType.None if all went well.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramResponse.SessionGuid
member.summary: The guid of the session the response belongs to.

member.name: P:BridgeSystems.Bridgemate.DataConnector.ScoringProgramClient.ScoringProgramResponse.SerializedData
member.summary: The serialized data. The DataType property tells to what class it should be deserialized.
